definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
flower/earlobe/fig. item on both sides/classifier for flowers, clouds etc

sentences.english: Cut the flower buds down and transplant them to bottles that with water.
sentences.chinese: 把花骨朵剪下来插到装有水的瓶子里开放。

sentences.english: Little fruit tree wake and send forth many flower in the tree.
sentences.chinese: 小小果树醒来了，长出一树花骨朵。

sentences.english: Counting the number of counts, inadvertently, I found a lot of Hua Guduo children.
sentences.chinese: 数着数着，不经意间，我发现了许多的花骨朵儿。

sentences.english: About the last of September the buds will start.
sentences.chinese: 九月末就开始打花骨朵了。

sentences.english: Came to the spring bud huaguduo.
sentences.chinese: 春天来到了含苞欲放的花骨朵上。

sentences.english: No, you can't come in, " the little Rosebud said."
sentences.chinese: “不，你不能进来，”小玫瑰花骨朵说。

sentences.english: They're just starting to bloom their tiny delicate blooms right now.
sentences.chinese: 现在，那些小小的精巧的花骨朵已经开始冒了出来。

definition: (of a plant) to be in bud
style of folk song popular in Gansu, Qinghai and Ningxia/CL:首[shou3]
